clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare, benign odontogenic neoplasm resembling odontogenic ectomesenchyme* Characterized by bland spindled to stellate cells in myxoid stroma* Requires radiographic and clinical correlation to differentiate from a dental follicle / papilla* References: [Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [J Oral Surg 1975;33:523](1056455), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275), [Oral Dis 2019;25:676](29683236)

Essential features

* Stellate, spindle shaped, round cells arranged haphazardly in abundant, fibrillary myxoid / mucoid stroma with infiltration into surrounding bone* Radiolucent lesion with thin, fine, coarse or wispy trabeculae of residual bone arranged perpendicular to one another (tennis racket or soap bubble appearance)* Recurrence is common due to infiltrative nature of the neoplasm

Terminology

* Odontogenic myxoma* Odontogenic fibromyxoma

ICD coding

* ICD-O: [9320/0](https://apps.who.int/iris/bitstream/handle/10665/96612/9789241548496_eng.pdf?sequence=1#page=89) - odontogenic myxoma* ICD-10
    + [D16.4](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D16-/D16.4) - benign neoplasm of bones of skull and face+ [D16.5](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D16-/D16.5) - benign neoplasm of lower jaw bone* ICD-11
      + [2E83.0 & XH48L4](https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http%3a%2f%2fid.who.int%2ficd%2fentity%2f1486607775?data=%7B%22dataType%22%3A%22pc%22%2C%22postcoordinationCodeSet%22%3A%7B%22stemId%22%3A%22http%3A%2F%2Fid.who.int%2Ficd%2Fentity%2F1486607775%22%2C%22axisToValueIds%22%3A%7B%22histopathology%22%3A%5B%7B%22stemId%22%3A%22http%3A%2F%2Fid.who.int%2Ficd%2Fentity%2F1059291964%22%7D%5D%7D%7D%7D) - benign osteogenic tumors of bone or articular cartilage of skull or face & odontogenic myxoma+ [2E83.1 & XH48L4](https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http%3a%2f%2fid.who.int%2ficd%2fentity%2f1037047819?data=%7B%22dataType%22%3A%22pc%22%2C%22postcoordinationCodeSet%22%3A%7B%22stemId%22%3A%22http%3A%2F%2Fid.who.int%2Ficd%2Fentity%2F1037047819%22%2C%22axisToValueIds%22%3A%7B%22histopathology%22%3A%5B%7B%22stemId%22%3A%22http%3A%2F%2Fid.who.int%2Ficd%2Fentity%2F1059291964%22%7D%5D%7D%7D%7D) - benign osteogenic tumors of bone or articular cartilage of lower jaw & odontogenic myxoma

Epidemiology

* Incidence is 0.5 - 17.7% of all odontogenic tumors of the jaw ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275), [J Oral Pathol Med 2016;45:599](26822069))* Wide age range but generally occurs in second and third decades ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))* More common in women but may vary by population ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275), [Oral Dis 2019;25:676](29683236), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;104:101](17507265))

Sites

* More common in mandible (67%) than maxilla (33%) ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))* In both the mandible and maxilla, more common posteriorly ([Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))

Pathophysiology

* Not well described* May originate from the primitive mesenchymal portion of a developing tooth or periodontal membrane ([J Oral Surg 1975;33:523](1056455), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;104:101](17507265))* May result from myxomatous degeneration of odontogenic fibroma ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;104:101](17507265))

Etiology

* Unknown

Clinical features

* Often asymptomatic, incidentally discovered by imaging ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;104:101](17507265))* Can present with slow growing swelling, rarely pain ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Oral Dis 2019;25:676](29683236))

Diagnosis

* Diagnosis is often made by radiographical evaluation and correlated clinical and pathologic findings ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))

Radiology description

* Unilocular or multilocular radiolucency ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2007;104:101](17507265), [Int J Dent 2021:2021:1093412](34257658))* Variable margins from well defined and corticated to poorly defined scalloped ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))* Characteristic radiographic finding of thin, fine, coarse or wispy trabeculae of residual bone arranged perpendicular to one another (tennis racket or soap bubble appearance) ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))

Radiology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Multilocular, radiolucent lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih01.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5503096/figure/f0010/)

Multilocular, radiolucent lesion

[![Right mandibular lateral occlusal view](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih02.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4948558/figure/F3/)

Right mandibular lateral occlusal view

[![Multilocular radiolucent osteolytic lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih03.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4948558/figure/F4/)

Multilocular radiolucent osteolytic lesion

[![CT scan of mandible](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih04.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4948558/figure/F5/)

CT scan of mandible

Prognostic factors

* Recurrence rates are variable, 10 - 43% and related to extent of excision ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))

Case reports

* 14 year old boy with maxillary mass ([BMJ Case Rep 2020;13:e234933](32843449))* 18 year old man with maxillary mass ([J Clin Diagn Res 2015;9:ZD29](26155585))* 22 year old woman with right mandibular mass ([Head Neck Pathol 2018;12:44](28508997))* 28 year old woman and 36 year old man both with maxillary masses ([Contemp Clin Dent 2015;6:131](25684930))

Treatment

* Surgical excision is mainstay of treatment ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275), [Oral Dis 2019;25:676](29683236), [J Clin Exp Dent 2021;13:e637](34306525))* Varies from curettage to surgical resection with 1 cm wide margin ([Oral Dis 2019;25:676](29683236))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Swelling on the right side](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih05.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4948558/figure/F1/)

Swelling on the right side

[![Mandibular right quadrant](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih06.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4948558/figure/F2/)

Mandibular right quadrant

[![Gray-white appearance](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih07.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5503096/figure/f0015/)

Gray-white appearance

Gross description

* Whitish gray gelatinous loose structure ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))

Gross images

Contributed by Kelly Magliocca, D.D.S., M.P.H.
  

[![Mandibular myxoma resection](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/grossmandiblemaxillamyxomaMagliocca01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/grossmandiblemaxillamyxomaMagliocca01.jpg)

Mandibular myxoma resection

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Jelly-like appearance](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxoma_nih08.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5503096/figure/f0020/)

Jelly-like appearance

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Stellate, spindle shaped, round cells arranged haphazardly in abundant, fibrillary myxoid / mucoid stroma ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))* Infiltrates surrounding bone ([Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))* Small islands of inactive odontogenic epithelial rests can be seen ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))* If abundant collagen is present, the term fibromyxoma is used ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377), [Eur J Clin Invest 2020;50:e13214](32048275))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Abberly Lott Limbach, M.D. and Kelly Magliocca, D.D.S., M.P.H.
  

[![Myxoid background with bland spindle cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach01.jpg)

Myxoid background with bland spindle cells

[![Bland spindle cells in myxoid stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach02.jpg)

Bland spindle cells in myxoid stroma

[![Inactive odontogenic rests](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillamyxomalimbach03.jpg)

Inactive odontogenic rests

  

[![Maxilla neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca17.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillawhoMagliocca17.jpg)

Maxilla neoplasm

[![Mandibular lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca01.jpg)
 
[![Mandibular lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca02.jpg)

Mandibular lesion

[![Mandibular lesion](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandibleodontogenicmyxomaMagliocca03.jpg)

Mandibular lesion

Virtual slides

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Odontogenic myxoma in mandible](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillamyxomaumich01.jpg)](https://www.pathology.med.umich.edu/slides/oldfilmstrip.php?loc=SCUyNkVfNTg1OG5sLnN2cw==&myname=5858&stain=H%26E)

Odontogenic myxoma in mandible

Positive stains

* [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html)* [β catenin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbetacatenin.html): nuclear positive staining is rarely reported ([Am J Surg Pathol 2023;47:1301](37678343))

Negative stains

* [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) ([Head Neck Pathol 2020;14:1021](32506377))

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* MAPK / ERK pathway activation ([Oral Oncol 2011;47:325](21444236))

Sample pathology report

* Mandible, segmental resection:
  + Odontogenic myxoma+ Margins of excision negative

Differential diagnosis

* [Dental papilla or dental follicle](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillahistology.html):
  + Immature dental pulp or follicle from a developing tooth+ Often requires clinical and radiographic correlation to differentiate from myxoma+ Dental papillae may show a rim of odontoblasts* [Myxoid neurofibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueneurofibroma.html):
    + [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) positive* [Chondromyxoid fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/bonechondromyxoidfibroma.html):
      + Presence of chondroid / mature cartilaginous component* [Odontogenic fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaodontogenicfibroma.html):
        + More cellular and fibrocollagenous+ Strands or islands of odontogenic epithelium more prominent* **Infantile sinonasal myxoma** ([Am J Surg Pathol 2023;47:1301](37678343)):
          + Short, intersecting fascicles of bland, stellate to spindle cells+ Prominent stromal vessels and variably myxoid to collagenous stroma+ Neoplastic cells exhibited bipolar to stellate, fibroblastic cytomorphology, with pale pink cytoplasm, vesicular nuclei and small, distinct nucleoli+ Pushing border rather than infiltrative growth+ No dystrophic calcifications+ No rests of odontogenic epithelium+ Mitotic index low (median < 1 per 10 HPF)+ Strong and diffuse nuclear [β catenin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbetacatenin.html) in majority of cases, rare [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html) positive+ Negative for [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) protein, [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html) and [desmin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdesmin.html)+ Molecular level: most tumors harbor *CTNNB1* mutations (D32Y, G34E, G34R and I35S) on exon 3 or *APC* alterations consistent with biallelic inactivation+ Combination of patient age, tumor site and strong and diffuse nuclear [β catenin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbetacatenin.html) expression generally distinguished infantile sinonasal myxomas from odontogenic myxoma
